search_results.snippet: Depending on how it is measured, the Rio Grande is the fourth- or fifth-longest river system in North America. The river serves as part of the natural border between the U.S. state of Texas and the Mexican states of Chihuahua, Coahuila, Nuevo Len, and Tamaulipas.
